data.answer: There are some ways that governments can minimize crime. Firstly, governments can invite citizens to have meetings with criminals in prisons. It provides an opportunity for citizens to get a better understanding of prison life. Once they realize that prison is not somewhere they would like to end up in, they will less likely to commit crimes. Also, they can listen to these prisoners about their regrets and the lessons that they have learned. It can help prevent these citizens from committing crimes. Secondly, governments can show educational materials, including images, videos, texts, books, advertisements, and social media posts, to citizens, so that individuals will gain a better understanding of the law. It can help decrease the crime rate.
data.referenceText: Discuss some ways governments can minimize crime.
data.referenceTranslate: 讨论一些政府可以减少犯罪的方法。
